meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel revulsion or strong disapproval.
meanings.sent1: The rotten smell of the garbage disgusted me.
meanings.sent2: She was disgusted by the sight of the dirty dishes in the sink.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked disgusted when it saw the cucumber on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The idea of eating bugs disgusted her like nothing else.
meanings.sent5: The slimy texture of the food made her feel disgusted instantly.

meanings.sent1: He had a disgusted expression on his face after tasting the spoiled milk.
meanings.sent2: The students were disgusted by the condition of the school bathrooms.
meanings.sent3: The dog made a disgusted noise when it saw the squirrel stealing its food.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a battlefield of disgusted thoughts and emotions.
meanings.sent5: The disgusted look on her face spoke volumes about her feelings towards the movie.
